Job Title: Project Manager III

Location: Lenexa, KS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production, Supply Chain

Description:
Location/Division Specific Information

Thermo Fisher Scientific – Microbiology Division (MBD) is a fast-paced organization that is seeking sharp individuals to bring the highest quality processes and products to our clients. Our employees are committed to making a difference in our organization, for our client partners and the patients we serve. We are looking for top talent with proven competencies to join our team and help lead our organization into the future.

This position is On-Site based in Lenexa, Kansas Site.Domestic travel expectation of 10%.

How will you make an impact?

The Project Manager III will report to the Sr. Manager of Practical Process Improvement and will manage strategic projects at the Lenexa, Kansas site.

What will you do?

Manage the Site Project Portfolio which includes New Production Introduction, Technology Transfer, Productivity, and CAPEX.

Align the Site Project Management Portfolio with all the internal stakeholders, leverage and implement best-practices, and standardize the project management practices and tools.

Lead and facilitate stage gate reviews, portfolio review meetings, and other project meetings

Collaborate with network and site functional teams to plan and deliver work

Be accountable for the successful execution of project timelines and overall program goals from initial scoping and concept through successful implementation and project closure while ensuring that project benefits are being delivered and realized per plan to the business

Coach Champions and Stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables with cross-functional teams

Proactively develop, integrate, and maintain comprehensive program execution plans, tasks, schedules, budgets, resource plans, tracking, and communication plans that instill confidence in project/program performance

Continually analyze and manage potential project risks to enable successful project completion. Develop, communicate and implement mitigation strategies and contingency plans

Produce periodic progress reports and update on project status to senior leadership or other partners using established communication mechanisms

Facilitate decision-making within the team to drive progress and ensure on-time and on-budget completion of project results

Lead site projects and operational excellence events as needed

Serve as a change agent – someone who can influence up, down, and across the organization, build consensus, and ultimately make positive changes to the business; sees opportunities to “find a better way every day” and empowers others to take action and/or challenge the status quo

How will you get here?

 Education

BS, preferably in business, science, or engineering.

Preferred Qualifications

PMP certification.

Experience

3+ years Project Management Experience required, or equivalent combinations of education, training, and meaningful work experience may be considered.

Implementation of Lean Manufacturing tools and Continuous Improvement methodologies.

CDMO And Commercial Manufacturing Experience Preferred.

Medical device experience preferred.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

Strong stakeholder management, relationship management, and leadership skills with the ability to motivate, inspire, and influence without authority

Ability to lead teams in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while maintaining strategic priorities

Project practices and tools – and knowing how to apply them to be purpose-fit for the program

Ability to grasp complex issues and ideas and translate them into key themes.

Highly collaborative team player who cultivates open communication and facilitates mutual understanding and alignment to resolve conflicts.

Strong business analysis skills, with the ability to probe, analyze and interpret issues and information.

Strong organizational skills, effective time management and focused execution.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to facilitate understanding and alignment laterally across functions as well as vertically to senior levels within the organization.

At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 120,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. 

We offer competitive salary, an annual incentive bonus plan, 401K with company match up to 6%, tuition reimbursement and a range of other employee benefits! We foster an exciting company culture that encourages innovation, forward-thinking, and an outstanding career and development prospects. Come be a part of the team!

Experience Level (if available): None
